Title: Police investigate crisis over Assemblies of God Church property in Enugu
Summary: The Crack Squad of the Enugu State Police Command has begun investigating the crisis rocking the Assemblies of God Church Nigeria over ownership and control of its property located at 35 Nanka Street, New Haven, Enugu .

Title: InfraCredit mobilises local currency debt for energy project
Summary: InfraCraCredit, a ‘AAA’-rated specialised infrastructure credit guarantee institution, has announced its credit enhancement of CEESOLAR Energy Limited’s local currency debt issue under a co-financing arrangement with the Climate Finance Blending Facility (CFBF).

Title: Mobile industry boosts Africa’s economy by $30b, creates 8m jobs
Summary: The total tax revenue in Africa reached $320 billion in 2024, representing an increase of three per cent over the previous year . The mobile sector in Africa made a substantial contribution to the funding of the public sector .

Title: PHED records 60% metering milestone, targets full coverage
Summary: PHED has declared 60 per cent metering coverage for its customers across Rivers, Bayelsa, Cross River, and Akwa Ibom states . The Port Harcourt Electricity Distribution PLC (PHED) targets full coverage .

Title: Soludo receives Certificate of Return, lauds Tinubu for free, fair polls
Summary: INEC issues Certificate of Return to Anambra State Governor, Chukwuma Soludo . Soludo was declared the winner in the 2025 gubernatorial poll held last Saturday .

Title: Macroeconomic stability, predictability key to attracting investors — Cardoso
Summary: Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) Governor, Mr. Yemi Cardoso, emphasized that Nigeria does not need to persuade investors to invest if the nation maintains strong macroeconomic fundamentals . Cardoso said stability and predictability are crucial to attracting capital . “Stability is at the core of the economy,’

Title: NDIC reaffirms 2wks deadline for banks to resolve customers’ complaint
Summary: NDIC has reiterated its directive to banks to resolve customers’ complaints within two weeks . The move, according to the NDIC, is part of its renewed commitment to customers' complaints .

Title: Panic as bandits abduct 6 Defence Ministry directors, kill 3 youths in Nasarawa
Summary: Panic has gripped the Federal Civil Service following the abduction of six Directors of the Federal Ministry of Defence by gunmen along the Kabba-Lokoja highway . This came as no fewer than three Migil youths have been killed by bandits .

Title: Nigeria unveils Africa’s largest fibre optics factory with local funding
Summary: Nigeria's digital infrastructure took a significant step forward with the commissioning of Africa’s largest fibre optic cable factory . Industry experts say the plant, built by Coleman Technical Industries Limited in Sagamu, Ogun State, is a strategic asset for national development . Title: Edun pledges review of capital gains tax to boost investor confidence
Summary: Edun assured investors that the Federal Government will revisit provisions on Capital Gains Tax (CGT) in the new tax reform framework to ensure a fair and investor-friendly outcome .
